info.description: Backend for managing dental clinic call leads.

get.summary: List all users in a clinic
get.description:
Retrieves a list of all users associated with a specific clinic.

The response is a simple array of user objects, containing only public-facing
information as defined by the `UserInClinicRead` schema.

schema.title: Response List Users In Clinic Api V1 Clinics  Clinic Id  Users Get

delete.summary: Remove a user from a clinic
delete.description: Removes a user's association from a specific clinic.

Alternative to WebSocket for clients that prefer polling.

schema.description: Clinic ID for which to fetch new calls

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of new calls to return
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of new calls to return

post.summary: Webhook to receive call data from AI service
post.description:
Endpoint to receive call data from the third-party AI service.
The service instance already contains the db session it needs.

get.description: Retrieve the full details for a single call log by its UUID.

patch.description: Update a call log's status or other manageable fields.

post.description: Provides advanced, multi-filter search for call logs.

get.description:
Get statistics about the WebSocket pub/sub system for monitoring.
Shows active subscribers, message counts, and system health.

post.description:
Creates a new internal note for a call log.
Only authenticated users can create notes.

get.description:
Retrieves an internal note by ID.
All authenticated users can read notes.

put.description:
Updates an internal note.
Only the creator of the note can modify it.

delete.description:
Deletes an internal note.
Only the creator of the note can delete it.

get.summary: List internal notes for a call log
get.description:
Lists all internal notes for a specific call log with pagination.
All authenticated users can read notes.
Lists all internal notes created by the current user with pagination.

post.summary: Get call volume trend data for charts
post.description:
Get call volume trend data optimized for chart visualization.

Supports multiple time periods and granularities:
- Time periods: last_24_hours, last_7_days, last_30_days, last_90_days, custom
- Granularities: hour, day, week, month

Data is automatically cached for performance. Returns:
- Time series data points with call counts by status
- Summary statistics (total, average, peak)
- Cache metadata for client-side optimization

get.summary: Get call volume trend with query parameters
get.description:
Alternative GET endpoint for call volume trends using query parameters.
Useful for simple chart integrations that prefer GET requests.

Get comprehensive call volume summary including:
- Overall statistics (total, average, growth rate)
- Breakdown by call status and reason
- Time distribution (busiest day/hour)
- Hourly call patterns

Perfect for dashboard widgets and executive summaries.

post.description:
Compare call volumes between current and previous equivalent periods.

Returns:
- Current period data
- Previous period data (if requested)
- Change metrics (absolute, percentage, average)

Useful for trend analysis and performance tracking.

get.summary: Compare call volumes with query parameters
get.description: Alternative GET endpoint for call volume comparison.

delete.description:
Clear analytics cache for a specific clinic.
Useful when data has been updated and fresh analytics are needed.

Clear all analytics cache entries.
Use with caution as this will force regeneration of all cached data.

get.description:
Get analytics cache statistics for monitoring and optimization.

Returns cache hit ratios, memory usage, and entry counts.
Useful for performance monitoring and cache tuning.

schema.title: Response Get Cache Stats Api V1 Analytics Cache Stats Get

get.summary: Quick endpoint for daily calls chart (last 7 days)
get.description:
Quick endpoint optimized for daily calls chart widgets.
Returns last 7 days of call data grouped by day.

get.summary: Quick endpoint for hourly calls chart (last 24 hours)
get.description:
Quick endpoint optimized for hourly calls chart widgets.
Returns last 24 hours of call data grouped by hour.

get.summary: Quick endpoint for monthly calls chart (last 90 days)
get.description:
Quick endpoint optimized for monthly trend chart widgets.
Returns last 90 days of call data grouped by day.

post.summary: Get call status distribution for pie/donut charts
post.description:
Get call status distribution optimized for pie/donut chart visualization.

Returns percentage breakdown of calls by status:
- NEW: Newly received calls
- IN_PROGRESS: Calls being processed
- DONE: Completed calls
- ARCHIVED: Archived calls

Features:
- Automatic percentage calculations
- Suggested colors for chart rendering
- Chart title and subtitle generation
- Zero-count filtering options
- Intelligent caching for performance

Perfect for dashboard pie charts and status overview widgets.

get.summary: Get call status distribution with query parameters
get.description:
Alternative GET endpoint for call status distribution using query parameters.
Useful for simple pie chart integrations that prefer GET requests.

get.summary: Compare call status distributions between periods
get.description:
Compare call status distributions between current and previous equivalent periods.

Returns:
- Current period distribution
- Previous period distribution (if requested)
- Status-by-status percentage changes
- Biggest increases and decreases

Useful for identifying trends in call processing and workflow efficiency.

get.summary: Quick endpoint for status pie chart (last 7 days)
get.description:
Quick endpoint optimized for status pie chart widgets.
Returns last 7 days of call status distribution with colors.

Perfect for dashboard widgets showing current workload distribution.

get.summary: Quick endpoint for status donut chart (last 30 days)
get.description:
Quick endpoint optimized for status donut chart widgets.
Returns last 30 days of call status distribution with colors.

Provides a broader view of call processing patterns over a month.

post.description:
Preview export operation without generating the file.
Shows total records, estimated file size, and sample data.

Export call logs to CSV/Excel format with configurable fields.
Returns download URL and export metadata.

get.description:
Download an exported file by export ID.
Files expire after 24 hours.

post.description:
Preview bulk update operation without executing.
Shows affected records and operation warnings.

Perform bulk update operation on call logs.
Supports status updates, archiving, and deletion.
Requires confirmation flag to be set.

delete.description:
Clean up expired export files (admin endpoint).
Removes files older than 24 hours.

get.description: Debug endpoint to list available export files.

post.description: Debug endpoint to test export creation with minimal data.

get.description:
Quick CSV export with default fields for a clinic.
Uses default fields: external_call_id, caller_first_name, caller_last_name, 
caller_phone_number, call_started_at, reason_for_call, summary.

Quick Excel export with default fields for a clinic.
Uses default fields: external_call_id, caller_first_name, caller_last_name, 
caller_phone_number, call_started_at, reason_for_call, summary.

Quick CSV export with simple filename (no spaces, traditional format).
Uses default fields with traditional filename format.

Quick export with custom filename.
Query parameters:
- filename: Custom name for the file (without extension)
- format: csv, excel, or json (default: csv)
Root endpoint for health check.

UserInClinicRead.title: UserInClinicRead
UserInClinicRead.description:
A lightweight schema for representing a User when returned as part of a
Clinic's data. It intentionally omits sensitive fields.
